title: A Discrete Topological Complexity of Discrete Motion Planning
authors: Hadi Hassanzada, Hamid Torabi, Hanieh Mirebrahimi, Ameneh Babaee
abstract:
In this paper we generalize the discrete r-homotopy to the discrete (s,
r)-homotopy. Then by this notion, we introduce the discrete motion planning for
robots which can move discreetly. Moreover, in this case the number of motion
planning, called discrete topological complexity, required for these robots is
reduced. Then we prove some properties of discrete topological complexity; For
instance, we show that a discrete motion planning in a metric space X exists if
and only if X is a discrete contractible space. Also, we prove that the
discrete topological complexity depends only on the strictly discrete homotopy
type of spaces.
